Articles.Content:
When i have too many stages in my rocket, there are so many that the buttons are in front of the Exit VAB button, and even scrolling with the mouse won't help with the buttons in the very start of the list. Any help for this? If images are needed i can provide them.

Edited November 20, 2014 by Unknow0059

even scrolling with the mouse won't help

i don't about you but scrolling always help unless its bug or something can you post an image ?
This is what i'm talking about

I don't have a solution, but I do have a workaround... save the lower half of your rocket as a subassembly. That way you an save your ship in two parts, and the staging list won't get that long. When you are ready to launch, you can combine the two halves again, and the launch button thankfully isn't obscured

This is a known bug that happens in both the VAB and SPH, fixing it has been suggested. If you are careful you can still click the exit button through the staging list.

I'm not being condescending here but have you made sure your mouse is over the staging column on the right of the screen when you use the scroll wheel? the pointer needs to be over the icons themselves.

This is a known bug, are you experiencing a difficulty?

Usually, you can modify the very top stage with some very careful clicking, or wait until launch. Alternately, create an empty stage or two to fill the gap, pushing the other stages down so you can work with them.

Last time I had this, it seemed to detect a press of the exit button even if there was a stage in the way.

Though if it doesn't, you can just save you ship, start a new one, then exit then.
have you tried changing the resolution settings or switching from windowed to full screen and visa versa?

Here's a workaround:

Grab the next stage below it, Stage 1. Drag it up so it's above stage 0. You can now access the former stage 0. When you are done editing, Drag it back above the new stage 0.
